title: [AUR:COMPONENT] Add Backstage (Goose) to Aurora
summary: We need to ensure the Backstage instance (being developed by the Platform Architecture team) is added under Aurora Platform Charts to serve as the main Front Door to the Aurora platform. This deployment must align with Azure Enterprise Landing Zone (ESLZ) standards, providing comprehensive support for both NaaS onboarding and Cluster Creation workflows as per the Azure team’s requirements for the initial landing zone specifications.

title: [SERVICE:GCSA] Establish curated artifact service across SSC + GoC
summary: Stand up GC Secure Artifacts (GCSA) as the government-wide trusted binary and container image repository, providing a single, curated source for secure, approved software components across all departments.

title: [AUR:COMPONENT] Upgrade Istio to v1.24 and Transition to Ambient Mesh
summary: We need to upgrade Istio from 1.16.x to an Ambient Mesh–capable release (≥ 1.24.x) to modernize Aurora’s service mesh architecture.

title: [CLIENT:STC] Support for Statistics Canada
summary: Provide ongoing operational support to Statistics Canada (STC) as they continue operating and maintaining the Cloud Native Platform (CNP) — Aurora’s precursor — within the broader GC Cloud One governance model. This epic focuses on coordination, technical support, and transition planning between the Aurora and STC teams, ensuring CNP’s continued stability, extending automation, and preparing for a phased transition to Aurora.

title: [CLIENT:STC] Update all Horizontal Services
summary:
All horizontal services should be reviewed, modernized, and kept in sync with current approved versions.
This includes ensuring consistent patching, configuration alignment, and version parity across management and client environments.

title: [CSP:PC] Onboard Aurora onto GC Private Cloud
summary: Extend Aurora’s footprint to the GC Private Cloud (OpenStack) by integrating with the work done in Rancher which provisions clusters on the fly using OpenTofu.

title: [AUR:COMPONENT] Switch from AAD Pod Identity to Workload Identity
summary:
Migrate existing AKS configurations from legacy AAD Pod Identity to the modern Azure Workload Identity model.
AAD Pod Identity is deprecated and will be retired in the near future.

title: [CLIENT:STC] Evaluate Migration of ingress-paz to CNP 2.0
summary:
The current ingress-paz service is already deployed on AKS but operates outside of the CNP 2.0 (precursor to Aurora) cluster configuration and governance model.
This issue tracks an assessment to determine whether the benefits of migrating ingress-paz into the standardized CNP 2.0 AKS environment justify the required effort and disruption.

title: [CLIENT:DND] Support for DND // Phase 1
summary: Provide dedicated support and collaboration to the Department of National Defence (DND) and the Canadian Armed Forces (CAF) in standing up a sovereign, defence-grade data analytics platform built on Aurora and Kubeflow.

title: [CLIENT:DND] Planning for Kubeflow AI v1.10.2
summary: This epic tracks the alignment, validation, and adaptation of Kubeflow Manifests for DND under the Defence Analytics, Trust, and Unified Mission-Insight (DATUM) initiative.

title: [AUR:DOCS] Aurora Platform Documentation
summary: Track the creation and maintenance of high-level Aurora documentation and reference materials. This includes architectural overviews, diagrams, and explanatory content that describe key concepts such as multi-tenancy, Namespace-as-a-Service (NaaS), security boundaries, and traffic isolation within the Aurora platform.

title: [SERVICE:GCSA] Ensure All Aurora Platform Charts and Images Are Proxied
summary: The Aurora Platform Charts currently support proxying through GC Secure Artifacts (GCSA) but default to using public OSS sources for Helm charts and container images.

title: [CLIENT:DND] Support for DND // Phase 2
summary: Provide dedicated support and collaboration to the Department of National Defence (DND) and the Canadian Armed Forces (CAF) to port the validated Aurora + Kubeflow baseline from the SSC enterprise tenant into DND’s cloud tenant, fully aligned with DND’s landing zone architecture, network controls, and security governance.

title: [CLIENT:SSC:Docuseal] Onboard the Docuseal Team to NaaS
summary: Leverage the Docuseal team's onboarding to validate Aurora's integration workflows, processes, and platform experience with the NaaS. This initiative serves as the first Proof-of-Concept (PoC) test of Aurora's platform, ensuring seamless client onboarding while identifying operational improvements.

title: [AUR:SECURITY] SIA for Aurora on Azure
summary: The purpose of this epic is to identify, gather, and provide the necessary evidence to demonstrate compliance with security controls for Aurora operating on Azure. This includes ensuring that all control requirements are reviewed, evidence is captured systematically, and submitted for verification in alignment with organizational policies.
